com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.neat

Class NEATSpeciatorOriginal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ComponentBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.core.Speciator<G,S>
            • com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.neat.NEATSpeciator<NEATGenotype,NEATSpecies>
              • com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.neat.NEATSpeciatorOriginal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable

    public class NEATSpeciatorOriginal
extends NEATSpeciator<NEATGenotype,NEATSpecies>
    Implements speciation according to the original NEAT speciation method with a few difference:
    • A target number of species may be specified with speciationTarget, in which case the speciation threshold will be adjusted automatically.
    • Individuals are added to the closest matching species, not the first matching species found.
    • It can handle alleles with multiple parameters (not just weight or bias).
    • Parameter values may be normalised (see NEATSpeciator.normaliseParameterValues) when calculating the distance between two genomes.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • speciate

        public void speciate(Population<NEATGenotype,?> population,
            java.util.List<NEATSpecies> speciesList)
        Description copied from class: Speciator
        Divide the given Population into species. Species may be added/removed to/from the given list of Species. Individuals in the Population should be added/removed to/from Species with the methods Species.addMember(Individual) and Species.removeMember(Individual).
        Specified by:
        speciate in class Speciator<NEATGenotype,NEATSpecies>
        Parameters:
        population - The population to speciate.
        speciesList - The (current) Species.

      • getState

        public java.util.List<ComponentStateLog> getState()
        Description copied from class: ComponentBase
        Sub-classes may override this to provide information (usually simple statistics) about their current state. This is useful for a Monitor or similar that is observing the Component. It is generally a good idea to call the super-method if overriding this method (except for the version defined on ComponentBase itself which does nothing).
        Overrides:
        getState in class ComponentBase
